heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.2°C) and outside temperature (up 3.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3036 lux) and cloud levels (up 121 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4693 lux), cloud levels (up 209 m), and feels like temperature (down 1.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 120.5m lower than yesterday, 113.8m lower than the past week, 208.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 949m and a high of 2390m, averaging 1417.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and bright intervals likely. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
